newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada's Viridian, Agrium to merge.
newsitem.headline: Canada's Viridian, Agrium to merge.

text.p: Agrium Inc said on Sunday it and Viridian Inc had agreed to merge in a stock swap, forming a fertilizer marketing and production company with market capitalization of more than C$2.5 billion (US$1.8 billion).
The company said in a statement that when the merger was completed Viridian shareholders would get 0.975 common shares of Agrium for each Viridian common share.

The merger will be accounted for on a pooling-of-interest basis. The current estimated cash balance on a proforma basis for the combined company for the year ending Dec 31 is expected to be about C$400 million (US$300 million).
"It is the intention of the merged company to use a portion of this cash balance for a subsequent buyback of approximately 10 percent of the then-outstanding common shares," the statement said.
Agrium averaged 69 million fully diluted common shares in the second quarter. Viridian has about 75 million fully diluted shares outstanding.

Viridian shareholders will be asked to approve the terms of the merger at a special meeting to be called by year's end. The completion of the merger is subject to certain conditions, including approval from Canadian and American regulatory authorities.
